name: The Value of a Home
description:
A mysterious storm comes along and whisks away your home and you must get it back. However every time you get near, it disappears again. Is there another force behind this strange behavior?

-------------------------------------------

Controls:

WASD or Arrow Keys to move

Space to Jump

Hold Shift to Sprint / Jump Higher

--------------------------------------------

Additional Controls:

Escape to Go to Main Menu

P to turn off Post processing effects (for better performance)

R to Restart

---------------------------------------------

How Less is More:

This game is being submitted to the BTP Game Jam with the theme of: "Less is More".

In this game, the protagonist goes on a journey to get its home back. The true meaning of the game is that no amount of material goods can be worth more than a place to call home. Without a place to call home, one loses part of themselves, part of them will always be missing, searching for safety and security. This goes for all other simple necessities of life. It doesn't take much to lose part of your identity that nothing other than that missing part can fill, but the smallest things make the biggest impact.

Also, the art style is really simple, so there's that too I guess.

P.S - Sorry for the terrible noise after you beat the boss, I don't know what's wrong with it.
